intro: Struthiopteris triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed shield fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Dryopteridaceae. It is characterized by its large, shield-shaped fronds that are typically divided into three lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of North America, Europe, and Asia. Its fronds are evergreen, and they remain on the plant throughout the year, contributing to its ornamental value. Struthiopteris triloba thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
